channel.title: Goddard News
channel.description: An RSS feed containing the latest news, images and features from NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Md.

item.title: NASA’s Lunar Flashlight Ready to Search for the Moon’s Water Ice
item.description: Set for a November launch, the small satellite mission will use lasers to search for water ice inside the darkest craters at the Moon’s South Pole.

item.title: NASA and ESA Agree on Next Steps to Return Mars Samples to Earth
item.description: Coming

item.title: Haunting Portrait: NASA’s Webb Reveals Dust, Structure in Pillars of Creation
item.description: NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope using its Mid-Infrared Instrument (MIRI) camera has snapped this eerie, extremely dusty view of the Pillars of Creation in mid-infrared light – showing us a new view of a familiar landscape.

item.title: Hubble Peers at Mysterious Cosmic ‘Keyhole’
item.description: This peculiar portrait from the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope showcases NGC 1999, a reflection nebula in the constellation Orion.

item.title: Elizabeth Tammi Gives Hubble a Voice
item.description: Elizabeth Tammi is the Hubble Space Telescope social media lead at NASA’s Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland. She started her NASA experience as an intern from 2019 to 2020.

item.title: NASA’s Lucy Spacecraft Views the Moon
item.description: NASA’s Lucy spacecraft captured images of the Moon’s surface on Oct 16, 2022, after flying by the Earth for its first of three gravity assists.

item.title: Ozone Hole Continues Shrinking in 2022, NASA and NOAA Scientists Say
item.description: The annual Antarctic ozone hole reached an average area of 8.9 million square miles this fall, an area slightly smaller than last year and generally continuing the overall shrinking trend of recent years.

item.title: NASA Welcomes Public to JPSS-2 Mission Events
item.description: Members of the public may take part in virtual activities and events ahead of NASA’s launch of The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s (NOAA) Joint Polar Satellite System-2 (JPSS-2) mission.

item.title: NASA's Lucy Spacecraft Captures Images of Earth, Moon Ahead of Gravity Assist
item.description: On October 13, 2022, NASA’s Lucy spacecraft captured this image of the Earth and the Moon from a distance of 890,000 miles (1.4 million km).

item.title: Virtual Launch Event for JPSS-2 Weather Satellite and LOFTID Mars Tech
item.description: Watch live as a new weather forecasting satellite and experimental Mars technology take to the skies!

item.title: NASA Coverage Set for NOAA’s Joint Polar Satellite System-2 Launch
item.description: NASA will provide coverage of the upcoming prelaunch and launch activities for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s (NOAA) Joint Polar Satellite System-2 (JPSS-2) mission. JPSS-2 is the third satellite in the polar satellite series and is expected to capture data to improve weather forecasts, helping scientists predict and prepare

item.title: Hubble Views a Turbulent Stellar Nursery
item.description: The lives of newborn stars are tempestuous, as this image of the Herbig-Haro objects HH 1 and HH 2 from the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope depicts.

item.title: NASA Instrument to Measure Temperature, Pressure, and Wind on Venus
item.description: VASI will be installed on the DAVINCI mission’s descent sphere to parachute through Venus’ atmosphere. VASI measurements will provide new information about Venus’ temperature, pressure and winds and will provide the primary altitude reference for the descent sphere’s atmospheric composition instruments during the plunge into Venus’ atmosphere.

item.title: NASA’s Hubble Spots Twin Tails in New Image After DART Impact
item.description: Follow-up DART observations from NASA’s Hubble Space Telescope are already revealing the clearest image of a stunning surprise – a newly developed second tail of ejecta.

item.title: NASA’s Webb Uncovers Dense Cosmic Knot in The Early Universe
item.description: Astronomers looking into the early universe have made a surprising discovery using NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope: a cluster of massive galaxies in the process of forming around an extremely red quasar.

item.title: NASA Readies Superstack for Upcoming JPSS-2 Launch
item.description: Two very different payloads flying on one rocket are ready for their ride to space.

item.title: NASA’s Webb Takes Star-Filled Portrait of Pillars of Creation
item.description: NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope has captured a lush, highly detailed landscape – the iconic Pillars of Creation – where new stars are forming within dense clouds of gas and dust.

item.title: NASA Study Finds Evidence That Fuel Regulation Reduced Air Pollution from Shipping
item.description: A global standard limiting sulfur in ship fuel reduced artificial “ship track” clouds to record-low levels in 2020. Pandemic-related disruptions played a secondary role.

item.title: Margaret Dominguez Helps NASA Space Telescopes Open Their 'Eyes' to the Universe
item.description: With physics, engineering, and educational outreach, Margaret Dominguez brings the universe into focus for space telescopes - and for young scientists.

item.title: TESS Status Update
item.description: TESS Status Update
